main event: On March 24, 1956, in East Gary, Indiana, the observer reported seeing three objects in the north and one in the east, which appeared to be emitting a red or orange light and seemed to be observing during his tour of duty.
interesting points: The observer saw three UFOs in the north and one in the east, which were described as emitting a red or orange light.
The objects seemed to be observing during the observer's tour of duty, indicating a sustained period of sighting.
The observer reported that the objects changed in color and brightness, possibly due to the change in the observer's position.
The report was completed by telephone with the observer, conducted by Lt S. A. Boehm, UFO-1.
The objects were still in sight when the observer went off duty, suggesting a prolonged sighting.
sighted object: four unidentified objects emitting red or orange light
witnesses: The observer during his tour of duty
